author: Elena Perry
title: Avista advises customers they can resume normal energy usage amid Spokane cold snap - Sun, 14 Jan 2024 PST
text:
Avista advises customers they can resume normal energy usage amid Spokane cold snap
Two days after warning of potential supply problems, Avista advised customers Sunday morning that they could resume regular energy use.
Avista asked customers Friday evening to conserve energy during a regional cold snap: lowering the thermostat, turning off heat in empty rooms, taking shorter or colder showers. The request was the result of a mechanical issue with natural gas compressors belonging to TC Energy, a natural gas supplier to the utilities company.
Avista announced Saturday night TC Energy repaired the problem, but the utility asked that customers consider conserving natural gas as well as electricity.
Avista spokesperson Jared Webley declined Sunday to comment on the cause of the mechanical issue, deferring to TC Energy. TC Energy could not be reached Sunday.
Saturday night, with temperatures near or below zero, more than 450 Avista customers, nearly 600 Northern Lights customers and 80 Inland Power and Light customers were without power.
Avista spokesperson David Vowels said the 450 without power were unrelated to the mechanical issue or conservation requests.
Sunday morning, 30 Avista customers were experiencing outages, according to the company‚Äôs outage map. Over 130 customers at Inland Power and Light were without power Sunday morning in Spokane and surrounding counties, restored by Sunday afternoon. Largely surrounding Priest Lake, 275 Northern Lights customers still were without power Sunday afternoon.
Avista engineers noticed a reduction in natural gas usage during the period of requested conservation, Webley said. Businesses, industrial and residential customers dramatically reduced energy usage, he said.
Avista‚Äôs natural gas pipelines have incurred problems twice in the past few months. On Nov. 9, a landowner ruptured a pipeline between Colfax and Pullman, leaving nearly 37,000 customers without natural gas services.
Webley said he doesn‚Äôt expect the issues to persist.
‚ÄúIt just so happens we had two once-in-a-lifetime events in the last three months,‚Äù Webley said. ‚ÄúThis was an emergency, one-of-a-kind situation.‚Äù
Inland Power and Light Co. asked similar conservation efforts of their customers; a post on Facebook from the company said ‚Äúextreme energy use‚Äù risked overloading electrical systems.
‚ÄúIf everyone reduces their energy use a little bit, it will have a massive positive impact,‚Äù the post read.
The utilities company recommended unplugging unused electronics, reducing use of appliances like dishwashers, clothes washers and dryers, and turning off unused lights.
Webley said Avista‚Äôs power grid is not at risk of being overloaded.
Spokane and surrounding areas are in the midst of a cold snap; some weekend temperatures set records for the area, according to the National Weather Service.
On Friday, the high was 13 degrees and the low minus-7, tying the 1949 record for lowest low for that day. The record for lowest high temperature for Jan. 12 was set in 1909 at 3 degrees.
Saturday set a record for the lowest high for that day at 2 degrees, edging out Jan. 13, 1950‚Äôs 4-degree high. Saturday‚Äôs minus-10 low ranks among the top-three lowest for the day, a spot currently held by 1909‚Äôs low of 13 degrees below zero.
Sunday‚Äôs low was minus-4, the high was 10 degrees. The record lows for Jan. 14 are a minus-7 high set in 1888 and minus-28 for the lowest low in the same year.

text:

author: Will Ripley; Mohammed Tawfeeq; Abeer Salman; CNN
title: With war raging in Gaza, Christmas is effectively cancelled in Bethlehem
text: With war raging in Gaza, Christmas is effectively cancelled in Bethlehem maxItemsPerPage: 10 totalITemsFound: maxPaginationLinks: 10 maxPossiblePages: startIndex: endIndex: Bethlehem, West Bank (CNN) ‚Äî Church bells echo through the labyrinth-like streets of Bethlehem. With Christmas approaching, the city in the Israeli-occupied West Bank should be teeming with visitors. But this year, it is almost deserted. Local leaders made the decision last month to scale back festivities in solidarity with the Palestinian population, as heavy fighting raged between Israel and Hamas in the devastated Gaza Strip. More than 20,000 Palestinians have been killed during Israel‚Äôs air and ground offensive, according to the Hamas-controlled Ministry of Health in Gaza and nearly 85% of the strip‚Äôs total population has been displaced. The war was sparked by Hamas‚Äô terror attack on October 7 on southern Israel in which at least 1,200 people were killed and more than 240 others taken hostage. Many here have ties to Gaza through loved ones and friends, and a sense of misery has fallen upon the city revered by Christians as the birthplace of Jesus Christ. Decorations that once adorned neighborhoods have been removed. The parades and religious celebrations have been canceled. In the city center, the traditional enormous Christmas tree of Manger Square is conspicuously absent. Traveling into Bethlehem, about eight kilometers south of Jerusalem, isn‚Äôt ordinarily an easy journey. The Israeli-built West Bank barrier restricts movement, as do the various checkpoints leading in and out of the city. It‚Äôs only got worse since Hamas‚Äô brazen attack. Since October 7, Israel has restricted movement in Bethlehem and other Palestinian towns in the West Bank, with military checkpoints allowing access in and out, impacting Palestinians trying to get to work. The occupied territory has also experienced a surge in violence, with at least 300 Palestinians killed in Israeli attacks, according to the Palestinian health ministry. ‚ÄúMy son asked me why there‚Äôs no Christmas tree this year, I don‚Äôt know how to explain it,‚Äù Ali Thabet tells CNN. He and his family live in Al Shawawra, a Palestinian village near Bethlehem, and visit each Christmas ‚Äúbecause our relationship with our Christian brothers is a strong relationship He and his family live in Bethlehem and visit each Christmas ‚Äúbecause our relationship with our Christian brothers is a strong relationship.‚Äù He explains: ‚ÄúWe join them in their celebrations, and they also join us in our celebrations. But this year‚Äôs holiday season is very bad.‚Äù Walking down the cobble-stone streets, the impact of the conflict is evident. Businesses were banking on a busy festive period after suffering through the hardships and travel restrictions of the coronavirus pandemic. But without the usual crowds of tourists and the faithful, many of the hotels, shops and restaurants have shuttered. Bethlehem‚Äôs economy depends on pilgrims and tourism, explains third-generation shop owner Rony Tabash, who stands outside his store waiting for customers who will never arrive. Souvenirs and intricately carved olive wood carvings of the nativity scene sit on shelves gathering dust. Tabash‚Äôs store is one of the handful to remain open, out of a wish to support the skilled artisans that delicately make his merchandise. Tabash brings his father with him to the shop each day to get him out of the house. His grandfather opened the store back in 1927 and this place, along with the square and its famous church, have become ‚Äúpart of our heart.‚Äù ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve never seen Christmas like this,‚Äù he continues. ‚ÄúSince three months, honestly, we don‚Äôt have one sale. I don‚Äôt want to keep my father at home. I don‚Äôt want to give up hope.‚Äù Even the Church of the Nativity ‚Äì which became the first World Heritage site in the Palestinian territories in 2012 ‚Äì is largely empty. In a normal year, queues of hundreds would snake around the car park outside with pilgrims patiently waiting to enter its grotto, considered since the 2nd Century to be the exact location of Christ‚Äôs birth. A 14-pointed silver star set into the marble floor marks the precise spot where Jesus is said to have been born. In the 4th Century, Emperor Constantine founded a church on the site, which was destroyed in the year 529, only to be replaced by larger structures, which form the basis of the church today. Inside, it would usually be standing room only. But this year, the fighting in Gaza has changed everything. Now, you can practically hear a pin drop. ‚ÄúI have never seen it like this,‚Äù says Father Spiridon Sammour, a Greek Orthodox priest at the Church of the Nativity. ‚ÄúChristmas is joy, love and peace. We have no peace. We have no joy,‚Äù he says solemnly. ‚ÄúIt is out of our hands, and we pray for the leaders who will make the decisions [all] over the world to God to help them, give them his light to make peace here and all over the world. CNN‚Äôs Kareem El Damanhoury, Eyad Kourdi and Sugam Pokharel contributed to this report.

China Resources Power Holdings Company Limited (HKG:836) Delivered A Better ROE Than Its Industry
While some investors are already well versed in financial metrics (hat tip), this article is for those who would like to learn about Return On Equity (ROE) and why it is important. By way of learning-by-doing, we'll look at ROE to gain a better understanding of China Resources Power Holdings Company Limited (HKG:836).
Return on equity or ROE is an important factor to be considered by a shareholder because it tells them how effectively their capital is being reinvested. In other words, it is a profitability ratio which measures the rate of return on the capital provided by the company's shareholders.
 Check out our latest analysis for China Resources Power Holdings
How To Calculate Return On Equity?
The formula for ROE is:
Return on Equity = Net Profit (from continuing operations) √∑ Shareholders' Equity
So, based on the above formula, the ROE for China Resources Power Holdings is:
13% = HK$15b √∑ HK$111b (Based on the trailing twelve months to June 2024).
The 'return' is the yearly profit. One way to conceptualize this is that for each HK$1 of shareholders' capital it has, the company made HK$0.13 in profit.
Does China Resources Power Holdings Have A Good Return On Equity?
Arguably the easiest way to assess company's ROE is to compare it with the average in its industry. However, this method is only useful as a rough check, because companies do differ quite a bit within the same industry classification. Pleasingly, China Resources Power Holdings has a superior ROE than the average (7.8%) in the Renewable Energy industry.
That's what we like to see. With that said, a high ROE doesn't always indicate high profitability. Especially when a firm uses high levels of debt to finance its debt which may boost its ROE but the high leverage puts the company at risk. Our risks dashboardshould have the 2 risks we have identified for China Resources Power Holdings.
Why You Should Consider Debt When Looking At ROE
Most companies need money -- from somewhere -- to grow their profits. The cash for investment can come from prior year profits (retained earnings), issuing new shares, or borrowing. In the first and second cases, the ROE will reflect this use of cash for investment in the business. In the latter case, the debt required for growth will boost returns, but will not impact the shareholders' equity. Thus the use of debt can improve ROE, albeit along with extra risk in the case of stormy weather, metaphorically speaking.
Combining China Resources Power Holdings' Debt And Its 13% Return On Equity
China Resources Power Holdings clearly uses a high amount of debt to boost returns, as it has a debt to equity ratio of 1.66. While its ROE is respectable, it is worth keeping in mind that there is usually a limit as to how much debt a company can use. Investors should think carefully about how a company might perform if it was unable to borrow so easily, because credit markets do change over time.
Conclusion
Return on equity is one way we can compare its business quality of different companies. A company that can achieve a high return on equity without debt could be considered a high quality business. If two companies have around the same level of debt to equity, and one has a higher ROE, I'd generally prefer the one with higher ROE.
But when a business is high quality, the market often bids it up to a price that reflects this. Profit growth rates, versus the expectations reflected in the price of the stock, are a particularly important to consider. text:
Weight Loss Concerns Rise with Fat Gain After Dieting
New York, NY ‚Äì In a concerning trend, a recent study has shed light on the potential adverse effects of certain weight loss approaches. The research indicates that individuals undergoing weight loss programs, particularly those without pharmacological intervention, may experiance a loss of fat-free mass, often replaced by fat tissue. This has prompted experts to re-evaluate traditional methods and explore more sustainable strategies for achieving and maintaining a healthy weight.
Underlying Concerns About Fat Regain The study highlighted a critical issue: that losing weight doesn‚Äôt always translate to a healthier body composition. Specifically, the tendency to regain weight as fat rather than muscle raises significant concerns. This shift can negatively impact metabolism , making it more challenging to lose weight in the future.
According to recent data from the Centers For Disease Control and Prevention , over 40% of adults in the United States are considered obese, underscoring the urgent need for effective and sustainable weight management solutions.
The Importance of Preserving Muscle Mass During Weight Loss Preserving muscle mass during weight loss is crucial for maintaining a healthy metabolism and overall physical function. Muscle tissue burns more calories at rest compared to fat tissue, so preserving it can help prevent weight regain.
Pro Tip: Incorporate strength training into your workout routine to help preserve and build muscle mass while losing weight. This can include weightlifting, bodyweight exercises, or resistance band workouts.
Experts suggest that a balanced approach to weight loss, focusing on both diet and exercise, is essential for preserving muscle mass.
Strategies for Sustainable Weight Management To mitigate the risk of losing fat-free mass and regaining fat, experts recommend the following strategies:
Focus on a balanced diet : Emphasize whole foods, lean proteins, fruits, and vegetables. Incorporate regular exercise : Combine cardiovascular activities with strength training. Prioritize sleep and stress management : Adequate rest and stress reduction can positively impact hormone levels and weight management. Seek professional guidance : Consult with a registered dietitian or certified personal trainer for personalized advice. Comparison of Weight Loss Approaches Approach Pros Cons Rapid Weight Loss Diets Fast results Loss of muscle mass, potential for rapid regain Balanced Diet & Exercise Preserves muscle, sustainable Slower results Pharmacological interventions Can aid weight loss potential side effects, not a long-term solution alone Did You Know? Studies have shown that individuals who lose weight gradually (1-2 pounds per week) are more likely to keep it off long-term compared to those who lose weight rapidly.
The Evergreen Approach To Weight Management For sustainable weight management, embracing a holistic approach is key. This involves not only focusing on the numbers on the scale but also prioritizing overall health and well-being.
Creating lifestyle habits that support a healthy weight, such as regular physical activity, mindful eating, and stress reduction, is more effective in the long run than quick-fix diets.
Frequently Asked Questions About Weight Loss What are the risks of rapid weight loss? Rapid weight loss can sometimes lead to a loss of muscle mass along with fat, which may negatively impact your metabolism.
How can I prevent regaining weight after weight loss? Focus on sustainable lifestyle changes,including a balanced diet and regular physical activity,to maintain your weight loss.
Is it possible to lose weight without losing muscle? yes, combining a protein-rich diet with strength training exercises can help you lose weight while preserving muscle mass.
What is the role of diet in maintaining a healthy weight? A balanced diet, rich in fruits, vegetables, lean proteins, and whole grains, is crucial for maintaining a healthy weight and overall well-being.
can stress affect my ability to lose weight? Yes, chronic stress can lead to increased cortisol levels, which may promote fat storage, particularly in the abdominal area.
What role does exercise play in weight management? Regular exercise not only helps burn calories but also improves your metabolism and overall physical health, making it essential for weight management.
Are there any medical conditions that can affect weight loss? Yes,certain medical conditions,such as hypothyroidism and polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS),can affect your metabolism and make it more challenging to lose weight.

Semaglutide & Tirzepatide for Obesity: A Comparative Analysis | NEJM Perspectives Obesity, a global health crisis, necessitates multifaceted interventions. This thorough article delves into the efficacy of Semaglutide and Tirzepatide , detailing their mechanisms of action, benefits, and real-world request in obesity management. We‚Äôll integrate insights derived from sources like the New England Journal of Medicine (NEJM) to provide a well-rounded perspective on these obesity medications .
Understanding Semaglutide and Tirzepatide Both semaglutide and tirzepatide represent significant advancements in the pharmacotherapy of obesity. They offer distinct approaches to tackling the complexities of weight management. Understanding their specifics is crucial for clinicians and patients alike.
Semaglutide: The GLP-1 Receptor Agonist Semaglutide , a glucagon-like peptide-1 (GLP-1) receptor agonist, mimics the action of the GLP-1 hormone.This hormone plays a pivotal role in regulating blood sugar levels, slowing gastric emptying, and promoting feelings of fullness. Semaglutide, through its action on the GLP-1 receptor , can lead to ample weight loss. It‚Äôs availability frequently enough comes by injection,but oral formulations exist as well. The primary function of semaglutide is to reduce caloric intake and increase energy expenditure.
Tirzepatide: The Dual GIP/GLP-1 Receptor Agonist Tirzepatide stands out due to its unique dual mechanism of action. It acts as an agonist at both the GLP-1 receptor and the glucose-dependent insulinotropic polypeptide (GIP) receptor. The GIP receptor activation contributes to enhanced insulin secretion and improved insulin sensitivity. The dual action of Tirzepatide is thought to give it improved weight loss outcomes compared to some single-receptor agonists. This weight loss medication works through multiple pathways, including appetite suppression and improved metabolic control.
Comparing Effectiveness and Efficacy The efficacy of semaglutide and tirzepatide in weight loss and the treatment of related conditions forms the centerpiece of recent research. Clinical trials and real-world data consistently highlight their effectiveness.
Weight Loss Outcomes: A Head-to-Head Perspective Studies comparing semaglutide and tirzepatide for obesity management reveal notable differences. While both medications facilitate significant weight reduction, Tirzepatide frequently demonstrates superior results. The dual agonistic approach provides an edge in curbing hunger and improving metabolic function.

Both drugs have potential side effects. Understanding these risks is vital for safe and effective usage.
Common Side Effects to Consider Common side effects may include, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and constipation. These gastrointestinal symptoms often subside over time as the body adapts to the medication. Discussing any side effects with your healthcare provider is imperative.
Risks and contraindications Both medications may present risks for individuals with particular medical histories, and are not safe for use by every single individual.both semaglutide and tirzepatide may not be suitable for patients with a history of pancreatitis, thyroid cancer, or severe gastrointestinal disorders. Patients should always consult with their healthcare provider to assess for contraindications and possible obesity medication side effects .
Practical Tips for Patients and Healthcare Providers Successfully integrating semaglutide or tirzepatide into an obesity management plan requires a multi-faceted approach. Here‚Äôs guidance for maximizing results.
Lifestyle Modifications: Complementing Medication Medication is most effective when paired with lifestyle changes.
